Package ui.drawing.colour

Class ColouredString

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.drawing.DrawableSection
      • ui.drawing.colour.ColouredString
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BufferedSection, ColouredElement, PrintHandler, Section
    public class ColouredString
extends DrawableSection
implements BufferedSection, ColouredElement
    Represents a single-colour coloured string.
    Represents a section that can be drawn to the terminal window.

    • Method Detail

      • getBuffer

        public ColouredChar[][] getBuffer()
        Gets the buffer. In this case return an array containing each character of the string.
        Specified by:
        getBuffer in interface BufferedSection
        Returns:
        The 2D coloured char buffer.

      • copyBuffer

        public void copyBuffer​(BufferedSection input,
                       int row,
                       int col)
        Copies another buffered section into this one at the specified position. In this case copy the colour of the first element and the characters of the top row.
        Specified by:
        copyBuffer in interface BufferedSection
        Parameters:
        input - The buffered section to copy.
        row - The row position.
        col - The column position.

      • getChar

        public ColouredChar getChar​(int row,
                            int col)
        Get the character at a specified position in the buffer. In this case return a coloured string of the character at the specified column.
        Specified by:
        getChar in interface BufferedSection
        Parameters:
        row - The row position.
        col - The column position.
        Returns:
        The coloured character.

      • getRow

        public void getRow​(ColouredStringBuilder builder,
                   int row,
                   int startCol,
                   int maxCols)
        Generates a single line of the section to be written to the terminal. In this case add the string to the builder, or if a startCol or maxCols is specified return the appropriate substring.
        Specified by:
        getRow in interface Section
        Parameters:
        builder - ColouredStringBuilder to handle ANSI colour coding in the most efficient manner.
        row - Which row of the section to generate.
        startCol - The column of the section to start at.
        maxCols - The max number of columns to draw.

      • substring

        public ColouredString substring​(int start,
                                int end)
        Returns a substring of the coloured string. Works similarly to the substring method of the string class (String.substring(int, int)).
        Parameters:
        start - The first index to include in the substring.
        end - The next index after the last index to include in the substring.
        Returns:
        The coloured substring.

      • getRows

        public int getRows()
        Getter for number of rows. In this case just return 1.
        Specified by:
        getRows in interface Section
        Returns:
        The height of the section in characters.

      • getColumns

        public int getColumns()
        Getter for number of columns. In this case return the length of the string.
        Specified by:
        getColumns in interface Section
        Returns:
        The width of the section in characters.
